summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of an unnamed female witness (referred to as 'Subject') conducted via video conference on November 5, 2021, pursuant to a proffer agreement. The interview, attended by her attorney and Assistant United States Attorneys, focuses on gathering Giglio-related background information, including her prior testimony, personal history, and potential impeachment material. The subject discusses her limited deposition in the Epstein case, personal history including a past marriage and divorce, minimal drug use, and an immigration incident.

persons.name: Subject
persons.context: An unnamed female individual interviewed by the FBI regarding her background and potential testimony. She states she was deposed as a witness in the Epstein case and provides personal history details.

persons.name: Attorney
persons.context: Present during the FBI's video conference interview of the Subject, representing her interests.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorneys
persons.context: Present during the FBI's video conference interview of the Subject, representing the government.

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: Present during the FBI's video conference interview of the Subject.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the central figure in the case for which the Subject was previously deposed as a witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in passing as someone the Subject's ex-husband was possibly connecting with on an ocean project, in the context of the Subject's relationship with Epstein.

connections.description: The Subject was deposed as a witness in the Epstein case and had some prior connection, as her ex-husband was involved with Epstein.
The Attorney was present representing the Subject during her FBI interview.
The Subject's ex-husband was possibly connecting with Maxwell on an ocean project, implying an indirect connection.

events.title: FBI Proffer Interview of Witness
events.description: The FBI conducts a video conference interview with an unnamed female witness under a proffer agreement to gather background and Giglio-related information.

events.title: Subject's Civil Deposition in Epstein Case
events.description: The Subject states she previously gave a civil deposition related to the Epstein case, with 2-3 lawyers present.

events.title: Subject's Divorce Proceeding
events.description: The Subject states she was previously married and divorced; she filed paperwork and her husband did not appear in court, leading to a granted divorce.

events.title: Subject's Last Marijuana Use
events.description: The Subject states the last time she used marijuana was around 2016-2017 when offered at a party.

events.title: Subject's Immigration Arrest Incident
events.description: The Subject describes an incident where she was flagged upon re-entry to the US due to a visa issue, held for about two hours, and then put on a plane home. It was not considered a deportation.

locations: New York, New York, United States
Washington (state implied from context of immigration check)
keyFacts: The document is an FBI 302 form recording a proffer interview with a female witness, conducted to assess her credibility and background (Giglio material).
The witness confirms she was deposed in the civil Epstein case but has never testified in court or before a grand jury.

The witness denies a wide range of potential impeachment issues: no criminal history, minimal past drug use (marijuana twice, suspected cocaine once), no mental health treatment, and no involvement in fraud, prostitution, or possession of child pornography.
The witness reveals a past connection: her ex-husband was involved with Jeffrey Epstein and possibly connected with Ghislaine Maxwell on an 'ocean project.'
The witness describes an immigration incident where she was denied entry and sent home due to a visa misunderstanding, which showed up on a criminal history check.
